thread.title: Asbestos scare at Royal Hobart Hospital construction site
thread.title_full: Asbestos scare at Royal Hobart Hospital construction site

title: Asbestos scare at Royal Hobart Hospital construction site
text:
Asbestos scare at Royal Hobart Hospital works where contractors potentially exposed Posted February 11, 2017 10:10:20 Map: Hobart 7000 
Contractors working on the Royal Hobart Hospital redevelopment in Hobart's CBD have potentially been exposed to asbestos. 
Project director Ben Moloney said the exposure in an area of E-Block may have been caused by an administrative error. 
Mr Moloney said before work started, the area was inspected by an independent hygienist and no source of asbestos was identified. 
But it appears due to an administrative error, a single positive test for asbestos from a previous investigation of the site was not identified by the hygienist. 
Mr Moloney said workers affected by possible exposure are being offered support and briefings. 
He said the works had been undertaken in an isolated construction zone, not a patient or staff area. 
"We are acting immediately to ensure our safety procedures are strictly enforced," Mr Moloney said. 
"Appropriate cleaning of the construction area has been completed." 
The area is being cleaned and Worksafe Tasmania has been notified.
